page.title: 12Health in Wilton District
page.content: The health of the people in the area is looked after at Wilton Health Centre. About 6,400 people use it. It is open from Monday to Friday and for emergencies only on Saturday. It provides a 24 hour service for the United Kingdom Land Forces. Each week about 840 people are seen, excluding emergencies. Working at the clinic are 2 community nurses, 1 midwife, 3 health visitors, 1 chiropodist, 7 receptionists, 4 doctors and 1 trainee doctor. There is a baby clinic and an ante natal clinic. Babies are seen within 6 weeks of birth. Baby food and vitamins are available. There are hearing tests for children. A foot clinic is held. A special doctor visits 2 local old peoples homes. Home help and meals on wheels are arranged by the health visitor.
